headline: The Western Union Company, Q4 2015 Earnings Call, Feb 09, 2016
componenttextpreview: Good afternoon and welcome to the Western Union Fourth Quarter 2015 Earnings Conference Call. [Operator Instructions] Please note this event is being recorded. I would now like to turn the conference over to Mike Salop, Senior Vice President of Investor R
componenttext: Good afternoon and welcome to the Western Union Fourth Quarter 2015 Earnings Conference Call. [Operator Instructions] Please note this event is being recorded. I would now like to turn the conference over to Mike Salop, Senior Vice President of Investor Relations. Please go ahead.

headline: The Western Union Company, Q4 2015 Earnings Call, Feb 09, 2016
componenttextpreview: Thank you On today's call, Hikmet Ersek Western Union's President and Chief Executive Officer; and Raj Agrawal, Executive Vice President and Chief Financial Officer, will discuss the company's 2015 fourth quarter and full year results and the 2016 outlook
componenttext:
Thank you On today's call, Hikmet Ersek Western Union's President and Chief Executive Officer; and Raj Agrawal, Executive Vice President and Chief Financial Officer, will discuss the company's 2015 fourth quarter and full year results and the 2016 outlook, and then we will take your questions. The slides that accompany this call and webcast can be found at westernunion.com under the Investor Relations tab, and will remain available after the call. Additional operational statistics have been provided in supplemental tables with our press release. 
Today's call is being recorded and our comments include forward-looking statements. Please refer to the cautionary language in the earnings release and in Western Union's filings with the Securities and Exchange Commission, including the 2014 Form 10-K, for additional information concerning factors that could cause actual results to differ materially from the forward-looking statements. During the call, we will discuss some items that do not confirm to generally accepted accounting principles. We have reconciled those items to the most comparable GAAP measures on our website, westernunion.com, under the Investor Relations section. All statements made by the Western Union officers on this call are the property of the Western Union Company and subject to copyright protection. Other than the replay noted in our press release, Western Union has not authorized and disclaims for any recording, replay or distribution of any transcription of this call. I would now like to turn the call over to Hikmet Ersek.

headline: The Western Union Company, Q4 2015 Earnings Call, Feb 09, 2016
componenttextpreview: Thank you, Mike, and good afternoon, everyone. Overall, I'm pleased with our fourth quarter and full year 2015 results. We delivered solid earnings despite global economic and geopolitical challenges, which demonstrates the resiliency of our consumers and
componenttext:
Thank you, Mike, and good afternoon, everyone. Overall, I'm pleased with our fourth quarter and full year 2015 results. We delivered solid earnings despite global economic and geopolitical challenges, which demonstrates the resiliency of our consumers and business model. Full year earnings per share increased 5% in 2015 adjusting for our second quarter payment settlement charge and all 3 of our business segments produced relatively good constant currency revenue growth during the year. Consumer-to-Consumer revenues increased 3% in constant currency with slight growth in retail initiated money transfer, boosted by very strong results from digital as Western Union constant currency revenues increased 26% for the year. Western Union business solutions constant currency revenue increased 7% and the segment's EBITDA margins improved from 11% to 15%. And consumer bill payments also contributed a strong year with constant currency revenue growing 11%. 
From a macro perspective, while the U.S. market was solid, many other parts of the world experienced slowing economic growth, depreciating currencies are geopolitical instability in 2015, and low oil prices effected several cent markets. As a result of many of these factors, we saw significant outbound declines in markets such as Russia, Angola, Greece, and Libya. Despite this, transactions and constant currency revenues in our retail money transfer business increased slightly showing the ongoing importance of cash to consumers around the world, while we continue to drive strong growth from our digital business. Operating margins increased from 20.3% to 20.9%, excluding the charge, and cash flow was strong again with approximately $1.1 billion generated from operating activities and over $800 million return to shareholders through share repurchases and dividends. 
Today, we also announced a 3% increase in our first quarter dividend, which equates to $0.64 per share annually, and we remain committed to consistently returning funds to shareholders. In addition to the financial results, we made important progress in key strategic areas in 2015. Our strategies are designed to leverage our platform and other capabilities to allow us to access more used cases and customer segments for cross-border money movements. In 2015, we continued our digital expansion adding 10 new westernunion.com online transaction sites which raised our total to 34 countries. We introduced WU Connect, which allows us to offer cross-border money transfer services on third-party platforms, such as social media and messaging companies among others. We signed our first WU Connect partnership in 2015 with We Chat, a leading Chinese social communication platform and we just announced our second with Viber, a leading mobile messaging app, which will make our money transfer service available to their consumers here in the U.S. 
We are in the process of putting promotional programs in place with both partners, and we believe these operatings will generate incremental revenues over the long-term. We also made additional investments in our technology in 2015 to position us for the future and rolled out further compliance and anti-money laundering enhancements. And we expanded our account payout network, which will allow us to target account receivers in the future. This is an important new potential revenue source for Western Union as funds into accounts make up the largest portion of the cross-border principal pool, and we now have the capability to send over $1 billion accounts into 50-plus countries. 
We will talk more about our strategic initiatives at our Investor's Day in March, but let me turn now to our 2016 outlook. We expect global economic growth to be challenging and currencies to be volatile again in 2016, and we believe we will continue to deal with external challenges and disruptions in various countries. The stronger dollar is also going to affect our repository results. We remain confident, however, that our multichannel business model will deliver solid transaction and constant currency revenue growth this year with strong cash flow and continued returns of funds to shareholders through dividends and share repurchases. We anticipate good constant currency growth from westernunion.com and business solutions again in 2016 and steady performance from a retail money transfer. 
Over the long-term, we believe the unique combination of our strong global brand, our network and our cross-border expertise and capabilities give us great opportunities to expand our reach in cross-border money movements, including adding new used cases with our WU Connect and account payout platforms. 
I will now like to turn the call over to Raj to discuss the fourth quarter results and 2016 outlook in more detail.

headline: The Western Union Company, Q4 2015 Earnings Call, Feb 09, 2016
componenttextpreview: Thank you, Hikmet. As I reviewed 2015 financial results, I will focus primarily on the fourth quarter. The similar information for the full year can be found in our press release and the attached financial schedules. Fourth quarter revenues are $1.4 billi
componenttext:
Thank you, Hikmet. As I reviewed 2015 financial results, I will focus primarily on the fourth quarter. The similar information for the full year can be found in our press release and the attached financial schedules. Fourth quarter revenues are $1.4 billion, increased 3% on a constant currency basis compared to the prior-year period, while reported revenues declined 2% due to the impact of the stronger U.S. dollar. The impact of currency translation net of hedge benefits reduced fourth quarter revenue by approximately $74 million compared to the prior-year period. 
In the Consumer-to-Consumer segment, revenues increased 2% constant currency and reported revenues declined 3%, while transactions grew 3% in the quarter. C2C constant currency revenue growth was driven by westernunion.com and solid growth from U.S. outbound. In the quarter, total C2C cross-border principle declined 4% or increased 1% constant currency. Principle per transaction was down 6% compared to the prior-year period, primarily due to foreign exchange translation as the fee increased 1% in constant currency terms. The spread between the C2C transaction growth and the revenue decline in the quarter was approximately 6 percentage points, including a negative 5% impact in currency. The impact of net price decreases was 1%, while mix had minimal impact in the quarter overall and pricing environment remains stable as our net C2C pricing change for the full year was essentially flat. 
Turning to the regions. Due to the significant fluctuations in foreign exchange rates, I will be referring to constant currency movements as I discuss individual country contribution to the regional results. In the Europe and CIS region, revenue declined 8% that was flat on a constant currency basis. Transactions increased 1%. In the region, strong revenue growth in Germany was largely offset by continued weakness in Russia. The Greece business improved compared to the third quarter as the market imposed restrictions were largely lifted although revenue was still below prior year levels. North America revenue was flat or increased 2% on a constant currency basis, while transactions increased 5%. U.S. outbound continue to deliver strong growth in the quarter driven primarily by cents to Mexico and Latin America. Our Mexico business again grew faster than the market based on the latest Mexico data for both the fourth quarter and full year. The domestic money transfer business produced improved trends in the quarter as transactions increased 8% while revenue growth turned positive with a 2% increase. 
In the Middle East and Africa region, revenue declined 5% or 1% constant currency and transactions were down 1%. Similar to the third quarter, declines in Angola and other African countries offset growth in Saudi Arabia and the United Arab Emirates. In Asia Pacific, revenue was down 6% or up 1% constant currency, while transaction in the region decreased 5% and continued weakness in the Philippines was partially offset by good growth in Japan and China. Revenue and Latin America and Caribbean region was down 2% or increased 5% constant currency while transactions increased 7% in the quarter. The regions constant currency growth was primarily driven by strong inbound business from the U.S. westernunion.com C2C revenue grew 21% in the quarter or 25% constant currency. westernunion.com transactions increased 28% with U.S. originated online transactions grew 35%. Electronic channels revenue, which includes wu.com, account-based money transfer through bank and mobile money transfer, represented 7% of total company revenue in the quarter. I do want to mention that we will be making a slight change to our regional reporting for C2C in the first quarter. Rather than separating the westernunion.com business from the regions, we will begin reporting it within the regional numbers spending, the revenue 50-50 between the send and received regions. With online transactions like now in 34 countries, we believe this will give a better perspective on total regional performance, while we will still continue to provide the westernunion.com standalone metrics as additional information. 
Turning back to the fourth quarter, in the Consumer-to-Business segment, revenue increased 4% or 9% on a constant currency basis driven by growth in the Argentina walk-in and U.S. electronic businesses, which is partially offset by declines in U.S. cash walk-in. Business Solutions recorded revenues increased 1% or 8% on a constant currency basis. This revenue growth was driven by Europe and led by strong sales of hedging products. The consolidated operating profit margin was 20.4% in the fourth quarter compared to 19.6% in the prior-year period. The operating margin benefited from lower expenses and incremental savings related to cost savings initiatives and from foreign exchange hedge gains. These benefits were partially offset by higher technology expense in the quarter. We recorded approximately $21 million of hedge gains on our revenue and profit lines in the current period up from $9 million of gains in the fourth quarter of 2014. 
Our cost savings initiatives. We had approximately $11 million of expenses in the quarter on actions to drive future cost efficiencies, which compares to approximately $30 million of such expenses in the fourth quarter of 2014. Additionally, prior cost savings initiatives contributed approximately $6 million of incremental savings in the fourth quarter and full year total savings were approximately $32 million. Technology spending and investment increased compared to the prior year as we invested enhancements to our platforms digital capabilities, settlement systems and data center transformation, all of which will continue in 2016. Compliance expense was approximately 3.5% of revenue in the quarter compared to 3.6% in the prior-year period, while the full year compliance expense was 3.6% of revenue. EBITDA margin of 25.4% in the quarter increased from 24.5% in the prior-year period. Our tax rate was 10.4%, an increase from 6.1% in last year's fourth quarter, which benefited from various nonrecurring items. 
For the full year, our reported tax rate was 11%. Excluding the impact of the Pay settlement charges in the second quarter, the full year effective tax rate was 11.8%. Earnings per share in the quarter was flat with last year at $0.42. An increase operating profit and fewer diluted shares outstanding were offset by the increased tax rate. 
The C2C segment operating margin was 24% compared to 23.1% in the prior-year period. The C2C operating margin also benefited from lower expenses and incremental savings related to cost savings initiatives and the foreign exchange hedge gains, which were partially offset by higher technology expense. The Consumer-to-Business operating margin was 11.9 in the quarter compared to 14.2% in the prior-year period. The margin decrease is due to the higher local currency expenses in Argentina, including various inflation adjustments and increased technology expense, which were partially offset by lower expenses and incremental savings from cost initiatives. 
Business Solutions reported operating profit of $4 million for the quarter compared to a loss of $5 million in the same period last year. The operating profit improvement was driven by lower expenses and incremental savings from cost initiatives. Depreciation and amortization for Business Solutions was approximately $13 million in both the current and prior quarters. The EBITDA margins for Business Solutions improved to 16.2% compared to 7.6% in the fourth quarter of last year. 
Turning to our cash flow and balance sheet. Cash flow from operating activities was $1.1 billion for the year. Capital expenditures were $60 million for the fourth quarter and $267 million for the year, which equates to just under 5% of revenues. At the end of the quarter, the company had $3.2 billion of debt and cash of $1.3 billion. The company utilized U.S. cash to pay out the $250 million debt maturity during the fourth quarter. As a result, about 30% of the cash was held by United States entities as of quarter end. During the quarter, we repurchased approximately 4 million shares for a total of $69 million. Our remaining authorization, which expires in December of 2017, was $712 million at year-end. The outstanding share count at the end of the year was 502 million shares. We also paid $78 million in dividends in the quarter and we're pleased to announce today a further 3% increase in our quarterly dividend. 
Turning to the 2016 in outlook. As Hikmet mentioned, we expect continued steady constant currency results from retail money transfer and good performance from our growth such as westernunion.com. We expect the C2C pricing environment to remain stable with strategic pricing adjustments similar to last year. Our money transfer consumers have been resilient, which has given us a reliable business model and solid earnings and cash flow generation even in some difficult economic time periods. Our outlook does reflect a challenging macroeconomic environment in many parts of the world and negative impact from the stronger dollar relative to 2015 average rate. 
Specifically, we anticipate foreign currency changes and reduced hedge benefits will negatively impact revenues by approximately $250 million and operating profit by approximately $100 million compared to 2015 rates including the impact of hedges. The outlook is primarily based on recent exchange rates with the euro assumed at $1.08. The estimated $100 million profit impact results from just over $25 million of reduced hedge benefits compared to 2015, approximately $25 million related to Argentina and the remainder from translation of profits in various currencies around the world. We expect the benefit of approximately $50 million from foreign exchange currency hedge gains in 2016, but this is down from the $78 million of benefit achieved in 2015. So the year-on-year impact on profit and margins from hedges is negative. 
In Argentina, the peso devalued in late December as new economic policies were implemented, and its value not more than 30% lower than the average rates for 2015. We have both money transfer and bill payments businesses in Argentina, which represent about 4% of company revenues last year. So the devaluation translates to approximately $100 million of revenue impact and approximately $25 million of operating profit impact. We expect compliance expense in a range of 3.5% to 4%, which is similar to last year. The margin outlook also reflects over $50 million of incremental technology expense as we make further investments in our capability. Otherwise, given the challenges from currency, we are managing expenses very tightly. Excluding all impacts from foreign exchange rate movements, the outlook for operating margins in 2016 would be similar to 2015. Achieving our outlook operating margin in 2016 would mark the fourth consecutive year of margins around 20% with currency contributing to the step up to 21% in 2015 and driving the anticipated step back to approximately 20% this year. 
We have worked hard to stabilize margins over the last few years and what has been a relatively low growth reported revenue environment compared with rising compliance cost, and we are pleased with our progress. We expect the tax rate to increase from 11.8% in 2015, excluding the pay charge to mid-teen level in 2016. And we expect the rate to be somewhat higher in the first half of the year than the second. Putting this all together, our initial 2016 outlook calls fo low to mid-single-digit constant currency growth with GAAP revenue of approximately 400 basis points lower than the constant currency growth, operating margin as approximately 20%. earnings per share in a range of $1.58 to $1.70, which includes an approximately $0.15 negative impact from foreign exchange and also reflects the impact of higher tax rate; and cash flow from operating activities of approximately $1 billion; similar to last year, the cash flow outlook excludes approximately $100 million of anticipated final tax payments related to our agreement, some are all of which may are currently 2016. We anticipate completing the remaining $712 million of our buyback authorization over the course of 2016 and 2017, and we also plan to issue additional debt to our lease partially repaid $1 billion note matured in 2016. 
So summarize, we were pleased with our -- to deliver our results in 2015 despite a tough environment. We expect to drive stable performance and continued strong cash flow generation allocation in 2016, while we execute our strategies to drive long-term growth. So with that, operator, we are now ready to take questions.

headline: The Western Union Company, Q4 2015 Earnings Call, Feb 09, 2016
componenttextpreview: Yes, Tien-tsin, the margins would have been about the same as last year without the currency impact. And that includes about a $50 million increase in spend in technology. We are saving other cost during the course of this year and that's why we are able
componenttext: Yes, Tien-tsin, the margins would have been about the same as last year without the currency impact. And that includes about a $50 million increase in spend in technology. We are saving other cost during the course of this year and that's why we are able to keep relatively flat margins. But certainly, if we have not had that kind of an increase in technology, then margins could have been better. But we are investing in our platforms and upgrading our core processing technology, which is a little bit dated and we think that's the right thing we would be doing.

componenttext: Well -- generally, we always as I -- like in the past, we look at M&A opportunities it looks fits up with our strategy definitely interested in digital environmental mobile environment. In that environment we kind of continue to look. It has to be fit with our strategy and if we are very disciplined and also on return on M&As. And so we are going to continue to look at that I mean I don't plan big M&As, but definitely strategic fit will be within our focus area.

componenttext: Yes, the pricing that you saw in the fourth quarter is nothing out of the ordinary. We still expect low single-digit pricing environment during the course of this year. Earlier in the year, we had some price increases that were offsetting some of the price declines that we had. So it's really just normal, normal course price changes in the market.

headline: The Western Union Company, Q4 2015 Earnings Call, Feb 09, 2016
componenttextpreview: I think generally our business is quite resilient. Our customers are quite resilient even to 15 economic challenges, the currency volatility, the geopolitical issues, our business and customers has been very resilient. We did see some impact of our global
componenttext: I think generally our business is quite resilient. Our customers are quite resilient even to 15 economic challenges, the currency volatility, the geopolitical issues, our business and customers has been very resilient. We did see some impact of our global and geopolitical issues like in Russia, we saw it Angola, we saw it in Greece, in Libya. These all countries had some affect to our revenues. But given up being in 200 countries, I feel quite comfortable to manage that risk. However, there is a huge geopolitical oil prices may be also have an impact in the Middle East urban business in long-term. And generally, year-to-date and last year, we saw a quite solid business and our customers are growing. Our growth is also coming from new incremental revenue, new customer segment adding on that with our online business, with our mobile business growing really strong. And these are new customers and it's not cannibalizing our strong retail money transfer business which is resilient.

headline: The Western Union Company, Q4 2015 Earnings Call, Feb 09, 2016
componenttextpreview: Okay. And then looking at the WU Connect platform, I know you have couple partners from potential partners and maybe on top of that, how do you estimate it will take start getting some more significant traction within this new channel?
componenttext: Okay. And then looking at the WU Connect platform, I know you have couple partners from potential partners and maybe on top of that, how do you estimate it will take start getting some more significant traction within this new channel?

headline: The Western Union Company, Q4 2015 Earnings Call, Feb 09, 2016
componenttextpreview: Well, it's definitely something that we have build over the years WU Connect, which has API connection to our platform which platform is basically our multi-settlement currency platform. Our compliance platform, our IT platform. We now give the platform m
componenttext: Well, it's definitely something that we have build over the years WU Connect, which has API connection to our platform which platform is basically our multi-settlement currency platform. Our compliance platform, our IT platform. We now give the platform make it capable for social media and for operators, messaging operators that they haven't access and use that. To build that, it takes years to have license in 200 countries. It's not easy. And in the past, we are opening that platform, that's kind of a closed platform for our agents. Now we are opening this platform also for new social media. One is We Chat obviously and the other one is, just announced a week ago, was Viber. And it will take some time as you know it takes some time. We have to promote that within the users, within the people who use Viber and We Chat and other social medias. We would like to expand that also to the other social medias, but we just put programs recent programs is the Chinese New Year, as you know that yesterday was Chinese New Year and we started the promotion with We Chat, which is the Chinese communication platform and we will see the results long-term definitely incremental results.

headline: The Western Union Company, Q4 2015 Earnings Call, Feb 09, 2016
componenttextpreview: Our next question is from Darrin Peller of Barclays Capital.
componenttext: Our next question is from Darrin Peller of Barclays Capital.

headline: The Western Union Company, Q4 2015 Earnings Call, Feb 09, 2016
componenttextpreview: So looking at overall I think the constant currency trends look fairly stable on most of the businesses. The exceptions I guess look like they are the markets you called out just in the last question around the outbound markets being oil sensitive markets
componenttext: So looking at overall I think the constant currency trends look fairly stable on most of the businesses. The exceptions I guess look like they are the markets you called out just in the last question around the outbound markets being oil sensitive markets, Middle East and Asia, to some extent I guess Asia may be a little less. But just give us some color on what your embedded expectations are for those markets? I mean, I guess, there's -- a lot of the companies we see reporting are having pretty big concerns over those economies obviously and when we take it a step further in the U.S., there is parts of the U.S., outbound market. I know that have historically been somewhat tied to oil-producing areas in the U.S. as well whether or not that's embedded in your thoughts. So little color on the producing per transaction growth in Asia being down 5%, Middle East down 1 and whether that's potentially going to get better or worse in the U.S. also?

headline: The Western Union Company, Q4 2015 Earnings Call, Feb 09, 2016
componenttextpreview: Darren, that's a good question actually. I mean if you look at our business, U.S. has been very solid. And even in Saudi Arabia and UE, we saw good transactions. In Germany, we saw good transactions. I mean, I have to be fair, Germany is not a oil produci
componenttext: Darren, that's a good question actually. I mean if you look at our business, U.S. has been very solid. And even in Saudi Arabia and UE, we saw good transactions. In Germany, we saw good transactions. I mean, I have to be fair, Germany is not a oil producing country, but you know that numbers have been very solid. Saudi Arabia and Middle East, Gulf countries, which has a huge outbound business has been stable. Definitely, there is some risk looking forward on this areas maybe have some -- oil prices are down maybe some economical challenges, but I feel quite confident with our resiliency of our business of our customers. And also we are starting -- you will see some announcement, additional announcement to our 34 countries adding new online capabilities especially also for Middle East for customers to be able to send not only retail money transfer but also online money transfer. I believe that will keep that stable. There is some concerns on the economic challenges. There is global environment is not stable. I am cautious about that, but -- customers don't forget also none of our countries out of the U.S., are bigger than 7% I believe of oil revenue.

headline: The Western Union Company, Q4 2015 Earnings Call, Feb 09, 2016
componenttextpreview: Yes.
componenttext: Yes.

componenttext: Yes, I mean, it's not like 14 or to be before the global trade is growing very strong. There is some global trade is not as we would like to see. Though, there is, Darren, as you know, there is something global trade could be impacting our business, but currently I don't see big changes.

componenttext: Right, I can't speak to your model, but for us we believe that the mid-teens tax rate is something that we would still have for the next couple of years. Obviously, it's dependent on tax law changes and other things that may happen. But based on what we know today, that's roughly where we see the tax rate. And this year, it came out to be right where we sat during the course of last year. We thought we would be back in the mid-teens and we are and that's what we see for the next couple of years.

headline: The Western Union Company, Q4 2015 Earnings Call, Feb 09, 2016
componenttextpreview: Some questions on commission expense, is this a year that we should expect an outsized amount of agent renewals? And how should we think about commission expense for the year?
componenttext: Some questions on commission expense, is this a year that we should expect an outsized amount of agent renewals? And how should we think about commission expense for the year?

headline: The Western Union Company, Q4 2015 Earnings Call, Feb 09, 2016
componenttextpreview: Sara, well, if you look at our business, it's not that we have 1 year that commission goes up and other year commission goes down. We normally our agent agreements are 4, 5 multi-years agreements, right? And so it comes, every year comes agent renewals. I
componenttext: Sara, well, if you look at our business, it's not that we have 1 year that commission goes up and other year commission goes down. We normally our agent agreements are 4, 5 multi-years agreements, right? And so it comes, every year comes agent renewals. I don't expect that big changes in 2016 on the commissions. I believe not that the commissions rates will go up or down. I mean, sometimes, there are some years go up, some years going on, but major changes won't happen, Sara.

headline: The Western Union Company, Q4 2015 Earnings Call, Feb 09, 2016
componenttextpreview: I mean, last year, Sara, we actually had a decline in commission rates, retail commission rates. And this year, we expect that commission rates will be relatively stable on segment side to last year. And really longer-term, the opportunities around reduci
componenttext: I mean, last year, Sara, we actually had a decline in commission rates, retail commission rates. And this year, we expect that commission rates will be relatively stable on segment side to last year. And really longer-term, the opportunities around reducing distribution cost as the mix of our business changes as we have more back funding, more bank payouts, that's going to naturally shift the overall distribution cost of the company.

headline: The Western Union Company, Q4 2015 Earnings Call, Feb 09, 2016
componenttextpreview: Absolutely.
componenttext: Absolutely.

headline: The Western Union Company, Q4 2015 Earnings Call, Feb 09, 2016
componenttextpreview: Great. Following up on that, I know it's really early, but any you could help us think about the economics will connect overtime?
componenttext: Great. Following up on that, I know it's really early, but any you could help us think about the economics will connect overtime?

headline: The Western Union Company, Q4 2015 Earnings Call, Feb 09, 2016

componenttext: It's really early as you said, Sara. We haven't really gone into those details. The model itself there is likely to be some kind of a profit sharing mechanism with the partner. And the pricing for transactions could be similar to wu.com for similar channels. And then, we do believe that these relationships could have a captive audience that we're marketing to versus the rest of our business because these are customers that are using these messaging apps and if we're embedded in the messaging app it makes it a little bit easier to find us if you will to use our services. So there are some opportunities here but too early to talk about specific economics.

headline: The Western Union Company, Q4 2015 Earnings Call, Feb 09, 2016

componenttext: And our assumption, Sara, here is also like westernunion.com is our additional incremental consumers additional revenue. We don't expect future cannibalization, but time will tell us our first search and first understanding is that these are incremental customers and revenues.

headline: The Western Union Company, Q4 2015 Earnings Call, Feb 09, 2016

componenttext: Our next question is from Ashwin Shirvaikar of Citi.

headline: The Western Union Company, Q4 2015 Earnings Call, Feb 09, 2016
componenttextpreview: So the tax spending on your network and processing infrastructure, I guess, the question is why now? Is it a competitive response to newer choices in the market like transfer wires or would it be fee put the benefit you get from the investment? And why yo
componenttext: So the tax spending on your network and processing infrastructure, I guess, the question is why now? Is it a competitive response to newer choices in the market like transfer wires or would it be fee put the benefit you get from the investment? And why you're kind of discussing technology I guess, a question we do get from investors is so you try to block chain? If you could kind of spend a couple of minutes just talking about the technology that would help.

headline: The Western Union Company, Q4 2015 Earnings Call, Feb 09, 2016
componenttextpreview: Sure. I spent, the text spending is not this year item only. We have been ramping up our text spending. We have some older platforms that are in place. So we are upgrading our data center, our data centers around the world in the United States.  We are al
componenttext: Sure. I spent, the text spending is not this year item only. We have been ramping up our text spending. We have some older platforms that are in place. So we are upgrading our data center, our data centers around the world in the United States.  We are also upgrading our settlement system and we are upgrading our core processing capabilities. So it is definitely and an effort to upgrade our older technology, but it also is going to allow us to be more flexible in the market as we move forward and as we have newer kind of partners. So it is really setting itself for growth in next several years. And then from a block chain standpoint, Hikmet do you want to add something?

headline: The Western Union Company, Q4 2015 Earnings Call, Feb 09, 2016
componenttextpreview: I think we are always looking at technologies like block chain and we also look at can we look adopt that block chain in our system within. But as you know, Aswin, our system is unique. The success of our system is we had growth in 200 countries because i
componenttext: I think we are always looking at technologies like block chain and we also look at can we look adopt that block chain in our system within. But as you know, Aswin, our system is unique. The success of our system is we had growth in 200 countries because it can payout in 121 currencies. It can adopt a regulatory systems of 200 countries and make antimoney laundering and process 22 transactions or how many transactions per second through that, Raj, it was?

headline: The Western Union Company, Q4 2015 Earnings Call, Feb 09, 2016
componenttextpreview: More than that.
componenttext: More than that.

headline: The Western Union Company, Q4 2015 Earnings Call, Feb 09, 2016
componenttextpreview: More than that, I don't know. Every seconds -- transaction. So the flexibility of our system is there. It's hard to beat that and we are adopting that's exactly what Raj said that we are adapting our system to the gaming environment. If the block chain is
componenttext: More than that, I don't know. Every seconds -- transaction. So the flexibility of our system is there. It's hard to beat that and we are adopting that's exactly what Raj said that we are adapting our system to the gaming environment. If the block chain is the better one, we will definitely look at it, but our team is very innovative here in Denver and in San Francisco and really looking at our capabilities. I am quite confident that we are -- we have made big steps in the last 2, 3 years in our technology and going to continue to invest. Otherwise, companies like We Chat or Viber or banks, big banks like LeBlanc or like big retailers won't work with us. They want to have the customer experience good. They want to connect to our systems, that's what we are doing.

headline: The Western Union Company, Q4 2015 Earnings Call, Feb 09, 2016

componenttext: I understood. And on a separate point, you have been stable at these sorts of transaction growth rates for a couple of quarters here. At what point do you decide that the growth rate just isn't good enough and that may be a price cut makes more strategic sense? It would seem like the current environment, you guys are not growing, but it maybe your smaller competitors might be suffering a little more. So it might be time to take advantage of that, how do you feel about that?

headline: The Western Union Company, Q4 2015 Earnings Call, Feb 09, 2016
componenttextpreview: With all respect, I would like to push back on your growth comment as that maybe on retail money transfer, the transactions are slow growth. But as a know, our westernunion.com and digital business is growing very fast. I believe in this many markets, we
componenttext: With all respect, I would like to push back on your growth comment as that maybe on retail money transfer, the transactions are slow growth. But as a know, our westernunion.com and digital business is growing very fast. I believe in this many markets, we are beating the competition and we are very competitive here, and I am very proud of the team. I mean even in the U.S., which we have been so long in the westernunion.com growing in the transaction last quarter grow 33% or 34%.

headline: The Western Union Company, Q4 2015 Earnings Call, Feb 09, 2016
componenttextpreview: Only 1% overall transaction growth, 35% of U.S.
componenttext: Only 1% overall transaction growth, 35% of U.S.

headline: The Western Union Company, Q4 2015 Earnings Call, Feb 09, 2016
componenttextpreview: Yes, original transaction of 3%. These are quite impressive numbers. So I believe that we are doing the right thing on our online business. And if we compare our business, it's on the electronic channels about 7% of our revenue. It's a quite big business
componenttext: Yes, original transaction of 3%. These are quite impressive numbers. So I believe that we are doing the right thing on our online business. And if we compare our business, it's on the electronic channels about 7% of our revenue. It's a quite big business and if you compare that with other competitors their absolute numbers are definitely not there and they are only active on few corridors. Their expansion capabilities is they don't have the WU Connect platform, their expansion capabilities, I believe are not there yet. And we are very proud of our platform and I believe we want to continue to expand there. You will hear more announcements, Ashwin, on expansion on digital, especially on digital. You will hear more partners and at same time you will hear also more westernunion.com countries coming on our platform.

headline: The Western Union Company, Q4 2015 Earnings Call, Feb 09, 2016
componenttextpreview: Ashwin, just I wanted to add to what Hikmet said, the lower growth that we are seeing in the transactions right now is really reflective of the continued global environments around us. I mean, we -- last year, we had a softer environment globally. We cont
componenttext: Ashwin, just I wanted to add to what Hikmet said, the lower growth that we are seeing in the transactions right now is really reflective of the continued global environments around us. I mean, we -- last year, we had a softer environment globally. We continue to see that this year. So things really haven't changed, that's really reflective about more than the pricing need.

headline: The Western Union Company, Q4 2015 Earnings Call, Feb 09, 2016
componenttextpreview: Our next question is from Jim Snyder of Goldman Sachs.
componenttext: Our next question is from Jim Snyder of Goldman Sachs.

headline: The Western Union Company, Q4 2015 Earnings Call, Feb 09, 2016
componenttextpreview: This is George on for Jim. I apologize if I missed this, but I want to ask you about the current pricing environment both in the U.S.-Mexico quarter following MoneyGram's contract extension with Wal-Mart, anything incremental there that you could point ou
componenttext: This is George on for Jim. I apologize if I missed this, but I want to ask you about the current pricing environment both in the U.S.-Mexico quarter following MoneyGram's contract extension with Wal-Mart, anything incremental there that you could point out? And then also in wu.com did you see any incremental pricing pressure as it relates to paypals acquisition?

headline: The Western Union Company, Q4 2015 Earnings Call, Feb 09, 2016
componenttextpreview: Sure. As Raj mentioned earlier, first of all, on the Mexico, Latin America, U.S. to Mexico corridor, obviously, a bunk of the Mexico data shows that we are definitely doing better than the market and that's not the first time and that been very consistent
componenttext: Sure. As Raj mentioned earlier, first of all, on the Mexico, Latin America, U.S. to Mexico corridor, obviously, a bunk of the Mexico data shows that we are definitely doing better than the market and that's not the first time and that been very consistent over the last quarters. And I am very proud of the team that they are doing a good job. We will -- we're going continue to do corridor-by-corridor pricing, suite corner pricing, really very intelligent pricing to attract new customers to compete on that, but I don't see big pricing changes. I really see the pricing environment quite stable. On online, when we entered into new market in our online business, we may do some promotions to enter into market to promote our channel there. But overall, I would say that market environment has been stable. Look, no one can send money from 1 corner to 200 -- like you hear from Denver to 200 countries for 500,000 locations, in 100,000 ATMs. Now also 1 billion accounts dropping money really in a fast through a efficient way in 131 currency. So that's what we are doing. It's not over priced, the customers like our product and they are really working on that. So the last question was on the wu.com pricing, as I mentioned on the wu.com pricing, I believe that it will continue to do promotions like we are being very successful on India promotions. And but our aim is always profitable, being profitable and online we are making money. Just I want to make the point that we do make money and we are increasing our margins also in online and getting profitable.

headline: The Western Union Company, Q4 2015 Earnings Call, Feb 09, 2016

componenttext: Our next question is from Kevin McVeigh of Macquarie Research.

componenttext: We haven't given that, Kevin. We are going from a roughly a 12% tax rate last year to mid-teens. So I will let you just do the math behind that, but we can easily calculate that impact if you will.

headline: The Western Union Company, Q4 2015 Earnings Call, Feb 09, 2016
componenttextpreview: Okay. I didn't know if there is any kind of new launches in there. And then just in terms of the continued spending on the compliance side, the 3.5% to 4%, is it the same type of spend and is that independent of the technology spend or is that all wrapped
componenttext: Okay. I didn't know if there is any kind of new launches in there. And then just in terms of the continued spending on the compliance side, the 3.5% to 4%, is it the same type of spend and is that independent of the technology spend or is that all wrapped in 1?

headline: The Western Union Company, Q4 2015 Earnings Call, Feb 09, 2016
componenttextpreview: Yes, it's a similar type of spend. The well over half of the spending is for people cost, and we have over 2000 people on the compliance organization here at Western Union. We obviously have them in various centers around the world. So that's where lot of
componenttext: Yes, it's a similar type of spend. The well over half of the spending is for people cost, and we have over 2000 people on the compliance organization here at Western Union. We obviously have them in various centers around the world. So that's where lot of the spending is, but we are continuing to invest in technology in outside services to optimize our spending there as much as we can. So but it is largely the same kind of spending, but just this is a global effort if you will. So we are going to continue to expand these programs around the world.

headline: The Western Union Company, Q4 2015 Earnings Call, Feb 09, 2016
componenttextpreview: Our next question is from Tom McCrohan of CLSA.
componenttext: Our next question is from Tom McCrohan of CLSA.

headline: The Western Union Company, Q4 2015 Earnings Call, Feb 09, 2016
componenttextpreview: What's your expectations this year for total growth in cross-border principal, which I think at the end of the year constant currency by 1%?
componenttext: What's your expectations this year for total growth in cross-border principal, which I think at the end of the year constant currency by 1%?

headline: The Western Union Company, Q4 2015 Earnings Call, Feb 09, 2016
componenttextpreview: Yes, while the World Bank has estimated principal growth to be 1% this year, but as we know that information is more directional than anything else. And as the data continues to come and get updated, we will see where that ultimately ends up. Last year, o
componenttext: Yes, while the World Bank has estimated principal growth to be 1% this year, but as we know that information is more directional than anything else. And as the data continues to come and get updated, we will see where that ultimately ends up. Last year, our principal grew by 2% on a constant currency basis and then was down 5% on a reported basis.

headline: The Western Union Company, Q4 2015 Earnings Call, Feb 09, 2016
componenttextpreview: Okay. And can you give us a sense for the portion of your total cross-border principal that is oil sensitive or eliminating from oil-producing countries?
componenttext: Okay. And can you give us a sense for the portion of your total cross-border principal that is oil sensitive or eliminating from oil-producing countries?

headline: The Western Union Company, Q4 2015 Earnings Call, Feb 09, 2016
componenttextpreview: Yes, I mean if you look at the oil-producing countries in which we operate, it's the revenue generated from those countries is in that 10% to 15% range. And it's really a mix story in those oil producing nations. As Hikmet mentioned earlier, the UAE and S
componenttext: Yes, I mean if you look at the oil-producing countries in which we operate, it's the revenue generated from those countries is in that 10% to 15% range. And it's really a mix story in those oil producing nations. As Hikmet mentioned earlier, the UAE and Saudi Arabia has continued to thus far show decent growth, but we have other markets like Angola maybe and others that are having and Russia as well that are just having a challenging time. So it's really a mix bag and then the broader impacts from lower oil prices in other outbound markets is also a mix story. We have had good growth in some key outbound markets as a result I think of just those situations. So but generally 10% to 15% of revenues is from oil-producing nations.

headline: The Western Union Company, Q4 2015 Earnings Call, Feb 09, 2016
componenttextpreview: And the trends post end of the quarter at Saudi Arabia and UAE were they still similar to what you experienced during the quarter?
componenttext: And the trends post end of the quarter at Saudi Arabia and UAE were they still similar to what you experienced during the quarter?

componenttext: Well, we don't give any interquarter information, but from the fourth quarter that's where we saw the tail really at the stage.

headline: The Western Union Company, Q4 2015 Earnings Call, Feb 09, 2016

componenttext: Our next question is from Bob Napoleon of William Blair.

headline: The Western Union Company, Q4 2015 Earnings Call, Feb 09, 2016

componenttext: Which of your competitors are signing a new contract with Wal-Mart. I think that contract -- the old contract excluded Wal-Mart from talking to Western Union, I believe. And this contract I think was less exclusive than the prior one. So I just wondered if you had any -- if there are any thoughts of Western Union was increasingly interested in Wal-Mart if you think there, and maybe I'll leave it there and get an answer to that question.

headline: The Western Union Company, Q4 2015 Earnings Call, Feb 09, 2016
componenttextpreview: Bob, good question, but as you know we don't make any comments on the any negotiations or any other specific partnership capabilities that could be from competitive reason and generally I don't do that. But I just can tell you that I am interested on any
componenttext: Bob, good question, but as you know we don't make any comments on the any negotiations or any other specific partnership capabilities that could be from competitive reason and generally I don't do that. But I just can tell you that I am interested on any partner to grow out my business. I believe that we will look always to grow our business and -- but it has to be profitable. It has to pay back not for any price, and we want to get new customers. We want to get additional customers, and we will definitely look in any potential partnership worldwide anywhere.

headline: The Western Union Company, Q4 2015 Earnings Call, Feb 09, 2016
componenttextpreview: You are not excluded from many of your other partners from working with Wal-Mart, and do you think nonexclusive are the way of the future in the U.S.?
componenttext: You are not excluded from many of your other partners from working with Wal-Mart, and do you think nonexclusive are the way of the future in the U.S.?

headline: The Western Union Company, Q4 2015 Earnings Call, Feb 09, 2016
componenttextpreview: In general, I would say that I can only speak for my business the exclusivity generally and the exclusivity has been very stable. And our top 40 agents or 35 agents they have been exclusive more than 18 years. And they -- most of the agents are choosing t
componenttext: In general, I would say that I can only speak for my business the exclusivity generally and the exclusivity has been very stable. And our top 40 agents or 35 agents they have been exclusive more than 18 years. And they -- most of the agents are choosing the exclusivity because they know they have a quite stable partner, financially stable, good anti-money laundering system, good settlement system, long rent capability, great rent and they can drop money in 200 countries immediately. So the executive count not to count both sides obviously, and they will like to protect good partnership for longer-term. Then we have also connections, we have IT implementation with our partners. And so I feel for my part of business quite comfortable on the exclusivity.

headline: The Western Union Company, Q4 2015 Earnings Call, Feb 09, 2016
componenttextpreview: And you are not excluded from working with Wal-Mart from like from Kroger or any of your other partners?
componenttext: And you are not excluded from working with Wal-Mart from like from Kroger or any of your other partners?

componenttext: I don't -- I can answer that question, but I guess not. I don't know. I mean you have to ask that question to the others, not to me.

headline: The Western Union Company, Q4 2015 Earnings Call, Feb 09, 2016
componenttextpreview: Okay. And Raj, you have -- you mentioned a $1 billion of debt coming due in 2016 with credit spreads having widened so much, is there any -- what it would be the impact if you were to refinance that debt today on your interest expense?
componenttext: Okay. And Raj, you have -- you mentioned a $1 billion of debt coming due in 2016 with credit spreads having widened so much, is there any -- what it would be the impact if you were to refinance that debt today on your interest expense?

headline: The Western Union Company, Q4 2015 Earnings Call, Feb 09, 2016
componenttextpreview: Taking everything into account, Bob, we see interest expense being similar to last year. So potentially higher interest rates for that refinancing, but we have lower overall average debt balance of this year as we paid off some maturities from last year.
componenttext: Taking everything into account, Bob, we see interest expense being similar to last year. So potentially higher interest rates for that refinancing, but we have lower overall average debt balance of this year as we paid off some maturities from last year. So those 2 things would largely offset. I would expect to see interest expense similar to last year.

headline: The Western Union Company, Q4 2015 Earnings Call, Feb 09, 2016
componenttextpreview: Okay. And last question with your Investor Day coming up and why now for the Investor Day and are you planning on giving any medium to longer-term financial targets as part of your Investor Day?
componenttext: Okay. And last question with your Investor Day coming up and why now for the Investor Day and are you planning on giving any medium to longer-term financial targets as part of your Investor Day?

headline: The Western Union Company, Q4 2015 Earnings Call, Feb 09, 2016
componenttextpreview: Well, as you know, our Investor Day coming beginning of March and we are very proud about our strategies what we have told to our shareholders are really how we transform the company, how we get to the new used cases, how we get to the new our WU connect
componenttext: Well, as you know, our Investor Day coming beginning of March and we are very proud about our strategies what we have told to our shareholders are really how we transform the company, how we get to the new used cases, how we get to the new our WU connect platform, how our strength is strong about our retail money transfer business. And we will also like to talk to the uniqueness of the Western Union cross-border engine, cross-border platform. And I think -- within that environment, we would like to talk to our long-term and all of our shareholders how comfortable we feel about future of the company.

headline: The Western Union Company, Q4 2015 Earnings Call, Feb 09, 2016

componenttext: Our next question is from Danyal Hussain of Morgan Stanley.

headline: The Western Union Company, Q4 2015 Earnings Call, Feb 09, 2016

componenttext: Just another one on the $50 million tax spend. I know it's early to talk about 2017, but just wanted to get a sense for whether this $50 million is elevated in anyway or whether this is maybe a go forward investment rate for now?

headline: The Western Union Company, Q4 2015 Earnings Call, Feb 09, 2016

componenttext: Well, the $50 million is certainly has some one-time costs in there. But again, we are trying to upgrade our platform. So there is also some ongoing cost in that spend. As we add more partners to the especially on the digital side, partners like Viber and We Chat as we have more of those, we will continue to invest in the technology area. So too early to say whether it's only one-time in nature or how much of it is one-time in nature. I expect some elevated tax spending to continue, but again that allows us to be faster to market, allows us to be more flexible on how we provide services. And it also allows us to add new kinds of partners to our business which is really why we are doing it.

componenttext: Yes, I would say is that we moved a lot of money around the world annually. We moved hundreds of billions of dollars around the world globally on an annual basis. And we have a lot of payment flows between our various companies around the world. So we try to optimize those as best as we can. And I am happy to talk more about that if you would like to, but it's really just optimizing the cash flows that we have within the company.

componenttext: Yes. I think absolutely. I think we are focused on the cent countries, major cent countries, obviously. The 34 countries, which I mentioned earlier, are the major cent countries. Now we are -- we have almost all European countries. Obviously, now we are starting to have -- or we are by the way in the Europe we are using our bank license there and to expand the westernunion.com. And now the next step is in Europe putting promotions and marketing programs there to drive the revenue even stronger, which is a good strong but the base is still small, but growing stronger. And now we recently opened an office in Asia to expand our activities -- also activities westernunion.com activities to Asian countries like in Singapore, Hong Kong, but also in Middle East like typical countries in Middle East, urban countries. And you will hear coming up new announcements on that using our capabilities. And I believe it's really attracting new customer segments, for instance, people who want to send in a different way, don't want to carry cash in a location and we saw the similar pattern also in Europe. These are additional customers not the one that use retai, but still they want to use Western Union and add additional growth. And that's going to happen I believe also in Asia.

componenttext: We have 16,000 corridors that we operate in. So we have a number of different combinations that you could InVision, but it's very hard for us to tell you specifically by country. So really it just depends on which quarters you are talking about, which channels and is the multitude of different combinations that we could be looking at. So Hikmet will tell you specific area where we do that.
