componenttext: Our next question is from Sara Gubins of Bank of America Merrill Lynch.

headline: The Western Union Company, Q4 2015 Earnings Call, Feb 09, 2016
componenttextpreview: Some questions on commission expense. Is this a year that we should expect an outsized amount of agent renewals? And how should we think about commission expense for the year?
componenttext: Some questions on commission expense. Is this a year that we should expect an outsized amount of agent renewals? And how should we think about commission expense for the year?

headline: The Western Union Company, Q4 2015 Earnings Call, Feb 09, 2016
componenttextpreview: Hi, Sara. Well, if you look at our business, it's not that we have one year, that commission goes up, the other year, commission goes down. Normally, our agent agreements are 4, 5, multi-years agreements, right? And so it comes -- every year comes agent r
componenttext: Hi, Sara. Well, if you look at our business, it's not that we have one year, that commission goes up, the other year, commission goes down. Normally, our agent agreements are 4, 5, multi-years agreements, right? And so it comes -- every year comes agent renewals. I don't expect that big changes in 2016 on the commissions. I believe not that the commissions rates will go up or down. I mean, sometimes, there are some -- some years go up, some years go down but major changes won't happen, Sara.

headline: The Western Union Company, Q4 2015 Earnings Call, Feb 09, 2016
componenttextpreview: And last year, Sara, we actually had a decline in commission rates, retail commission rates. And this year, we expect that commission rates will be relatively stable, as Hikmet said, to last year. And really, longer-term, the opportunities around reducing
componenttext: And last year, Sara, we actually had a decline in commission rates, retail commission rates. And this year, we expect that commission rates will be relatively stable, as Hikmet said, to last year. And really, longer-term, the opportunities around reducing distribution cost as the mix of our business changes. As we have more back funding, more bank payout, that's going to naturally shift the overall distribution cost of the company.

headline: The Western Union Company, Q4 2015 Earnings Call, Feb 09, 2016
componenttextpreview: Absolutely.
componenttext: Absolutely.

headline: The Western Union Company, Q4 2015 Earnings Call, Feb 09, 2016
componenttextpreview: Great. Following up on that, I know it's really early but any chance you could help us think about the economics of WU Connect over time?
componenttext: Great. Following up on that, I know it's really early but any chance you could help us think about the economics of WU Connect over time?

headline: The Western Union Company, Q4 2015 Earnings Call, Feb 09, 2016
componenttextpreview: It's really early, as you said, Sara. We haven't really gone into those details. The model itself, there's likely to be some kind of a profit sharing mechanism with a partner. And the pricing for transactions could be similar to wu.com for similar channel
componenttext: It's really early, as you said, Sara. We haven't really gone into those details. The model itself, there's likely to be some kind of a profit sharing mechanism with a partner. And the pricing for transactions could be similar to wu.com for similar channels. And then we do believe that these relationships could have a captive audience that we're marketing to versus the rest of our business because these are customers that are using these messaging apps. And if we're embedded in the messaging app, it makes it a little bit easier to find us, if you will, to use our services. So there's some opportunities here but too early to talk about specific economics.

headline: The Western Union Company, Q4 2015 Earnings Call, Feb 09, 2016
componenttextpreview: And our assumption, Sara, here is also like in westernunion.com, is our additional incremental cost, consumers additional revenue, we don't expect huge cannibalization, but time will tell us. Our first search and first understanding is that these are incr
componenttext: And our assumption, Sara, here is also like in westernunion.com, is our additional incremental cost, consumers additional revenue, we don't expect huge cannibalization, but time will tell us. Our first search and first understanding is that these are incremental customers and revenues.

headline: The Western Union Company, Q4 2015 Earnings Call, Feb 09, 2016
componenttextpreview: Our next question is from Ashwin Shirvaikar of Citi.
componenttext: Our next question is from Ashwin Shirvaikar of Citi.

headline: The Western Union Company, Q4 2015 Earnings Call, Feb 09, 2016
componenttextpreview: So the tax spending on your network and processing infrastructure, I guess, the question is why now? Is it a competitive response to newer choices in the market like transfer wires or remitting [ph]? What's the benefits you get from the investment and why
componenttext: So the tax spending on your network and processing infrastructure, I guess, the question is why now? Is it a competitive response to newer choices in the market like transfer wires or remitting [ph]? What's the benefits you get from the investment and why you're kind of discussing technology, I guess? A question we do get from investors is so you try to blockchain. If you could kind of spend a couple of minutes talking about these technologies, that would help.

headline: The Western Union Company, Q4 2015 Earnings Call, Feb 09, 2016
componenttextpreview: Sure, Ashwin. The tech spending is not a this year item only. We have been ramping up our tech spending. We have some older platforms that are in place. So we're upgrading our data centers around the world and in the United States. We're also upgrading ou
componenttext: Sure, Ashwin. The tech spending is not a this year item only. We have been ramping up our tech spending. We have some older platforms that are in place. So we're upgrading our data centers around the world and in the United States. We're also upgrading our settlement system and we're upgrading our core processing capabilities. So it is definitely in an effort to upgrade our older technology, but it also is going to allow us to be more flexible in the market as we move forward and as we have newer kinds of partners. So it is really setting us up for growth the next several years. And then from a blockchain standpoint, Hikmet, do you want to add something?

headline: The Western Union Company, Q4 2015 Earnings Call, Feb 09, 2016
componenttextpreview: I think we are always looking at technologies like blockchain and we also look at can we look, adapt that -- a blockchain in our system within. But as you know, Ashwin, our system is unique. The success of our system is that it works in 200 countries beca
componenttext: I think we are always looking at technologies like blockchain and we also look at can we look, adapt that -- a blockchain in our system within. But as you know, Ashwin, our system is unique. The success of our system is that it works in 200 countries because it can payout in 121 currencies. It can adopt [ph] the regulatory systems of 200 countries and make anti money laundering and process 22 transactions or how many transactions per second with that, Raj?

headline: The Western Union Company, Q4 2015 Earnings Call, Feb 09, 2016
componenttextpreview: More than that.
componenttext: More than that.

headline: The Western Union Company, Q4 2015 Earnings Call, Feb 09, 2016
componenttextpreview: More than that, so I don't know. Every second, a transaction. So the flexibility of our system is there. It's hard to beat that and we are adapting. That's exactly what Raj said, that we are adapting our system to the gaming environment. If the blockchain
componenttext: More than that, so I don't know. Every second, a transaction. So the flexibility of our system is there. It's hard to beat that and we are adapting. That's exactly what Raj said, that we are adapting our system to the gaming environment. If the blockchain is the better one, we will definitely look at it, but our team is very innovative here in Denver and in San Francisco and really looking at our capabilities. I am quite confident that we are -- we have made big steps the last 2, 3 years in our technology and going to continue to invest. Otherwise, companies like WeChat or Viber or banks, big banks like La Banque Postale or like big retailers won't work with us. They want to have the customer experience good. They want to connect to our systems, so that's what we are doing.

headline: The Western Union Company, Q4 2015 Earnings Call, Feb 09, 2016
componenttextpreview: Understood. And on a separate point, you've been so stable at these sorts of transaction growth rates for a couple of quarters here. At what point do you decide that the growth rate just isn't good enough and that maybe a price cut makes more strategic se
componenttext: Understood. And on a separate point, you've been so stable at these sorts of transaction growth rates for a couple of quarters here. At what point do you decide that the growth rate just isn't good enough and that maybe a price cut makes more strategic sense? It would seem like the current environment, you guys are not growing but if maybe your smaller competitors might be suffering a little more, so it might be time to take advantage of that. How do you feel about that?

headline: The Western Union Company, Q4 2015 Earnings Call, Feb 09, 2016
componenttextpreview: With all respect, I would like to push back on your growth comment as that maybe on retail money transfer, the transactions are slow growth. But as you know, our westernunion.com and digital business is growing very fast. I believe in this many markets, w
componenttext: With all respect, I would like to push back on your growth comment as that maybe on retail money transfer, the transactions are slow growth. But as you know, our westernunion.com and digital business is growing very fast. I believe in this many markets, we are beating the competition and we are very competitive here, and I am very proud of the team. And even in the U.S., which we've been so long in the westernunion.com, growing in the transaction last quarter grew 33% or 34%.

headline: The Western Union Company, Q4 2015 Earnings Call, Feb 09, 2016
componenttextpreview: 28% overall transaction growth, 35% of U.S. originations.
componenttext: 28% overall transaction growth, 35% of U.S. originations.

headline: The Western Union Company, Q4 2015 Earnings Call, Feb 09, 2016
componenttextpreview: U.S. originated transaction, 35%. These are quite impressive numbers, so I believe that we are doing the right thing on our online business. And if we compare our business, it's -- on the electronic channels, about 7% of our revenue, it's a quite big busi
componenttext: U.S. originated transaction, 35%. These are quite impressive numbers, so I believe that we are doing the right thing on our online business. And if we compare our business, it's -- on the electronic channels, about 7% of our revenue, it's a quite big business. And if you compare that with other competitors, their absolute numbers are definitely not there and they are only active on few corridors. Their expansion capabilities is they don't have the WU Connect platform, their expansion capabilities is, I believe, not there yet. And we are very proud of our platform and I think we're going to continue to expand there. You will hear more announcements, Ashwin, on expansion on digital, especially on digital. You will hear more partners and at same time, you will hear also more westernunion.com countries coming on our platform.

headline: The Western Union Company, Q4 2015 Earnings Call, Feb 09, 2016
componenttextpreview: Ashwin, just I wanted to add to what Hikmet said. The lower growth that we're seeing in the transactions right now is really reflective of the continued global environments around us. I mean, we -- last year, we had a softer environment globally and we co
componenttext: Ashwin, just I wanted to add to what Hikmet said. The lower growth that we're seeing in the transactions right now is really reflective of the continued global environments around us. I mean, we -- last year, we had a softer environment globally and we continue to see that this year. So things really haven't changed. It's really reflective of that more than the pricing need.

headline: The Western Union Company, Q4 2015 Earnings Call, Feb 09, 2016
componenttextpreview: Our next question is from Jim Snyder of Goldman Sachs.
componenttext: Our next question is from Jim Snyder of Goldman Sachs.

headline: The Western Union Company, Q4 2015 Earnings Call, Feb 09, 2016
componenttextpreview: This is Jordan on for Jim. I apologize if I missed this but I just want to ask you about the current pricing environment both in the U.S.-Mexico quarter following MoneyGram's contract extension with Walmart. Anything incremental there that you could point
componenttext: This is Jordan on for Jim. I apologize if I missed this but I just want to ask you about the current pricing environment both in the U.S.-Mexico quarter following MoneyGram's contract extension with Walmart. Anything incremental there that you could point out? And then also in wu.com, did you see any incremental pricing pressure as it relates to Xoom following PayPal's acquisition?

headline: The Western Union Company, Q4 2015 Earnings Call, Feb 09, 2016
componenttextpreview: Sure. As Raj mentioned earlier, first of all, on the Mexico, Latin America, U.S. to Mexico corridor, obviously, a bunk of the Mexico data shows that we are definitely doing better than the market. And that's not the first time and that's been very consist
componenttext: Sure. As Raj mentioned earlier, first of all, on the Mexico, Latin America, U.S. to Mexico corridor, obviously, a bunk of the Mexico data shows that we are definitely doing better than the market. And that's not the first time and that's been very consistent over the last quarters, and I am very proud of the team that they are doing a good job. We will -- we're going continue to do corridor-by-corridor pricing, suite corner pricing, really very intelligent pricing to attract new customers to compete on that, but I don't see big pricing changes. I really see the pricing environment quite stable. On online, when we enter into a new market in our online business, we may do some promotions to enter in the market to promote our channel there. But overall, I would say that the market environment has been stable. Look, no one can send money from one corner to 200 -- like you hear from Denver to 200 countries in 500,000 locations, in 100,000 ATMs. Now also, 1 billion accounts dropping money really in a fast, efficient way in 131 currencies. So that's what we are doing. It's not overpriced, the customers like our product and they are really working on that. So the last question was on the wu.com pricing. As I mentioned on the wu.com pricing, I believe that we will continue to do promotions like we are being very successful on India promotions. But our aim is always profitable, being profitable and in online, we are making money. Just I want to make a point that we do make money and we are increasing our margins also in online and getting profitable.

headline: The Western Union Company, Q4 2015 Earnings Call, Feb 09, 2016
componenttextpreview: Our next question is from Kevin McVeigh of Macquarie Research.
componenttext: Our next question is from Kevin McVeigh of Macquarie Research.

headline: The Western Union Company, Q4 2015 Earnings Call, Feb 09, 2016

componenttext: In terms of the uptick in the tax rate, what's the actual EPS impact to that in terms of just -- how much of that impact is '17 -- is '16 guidance?

headline: The Western Union Company, Q4 2015 Earnings Call, Feb 09, 2016
componenttextpreview: We haven't given that, Kevin. We're going from roughly a 12% tax rate last year to mid-teens. So I'll let you just do the math behind that, but you can easily calculate that impact, if you will.
componenttext: We haven't given that, Kevin. We're going from roughly a 12% tax rate last year to mid-teens. So I'll let you just do the math behind that, but you can easily calculate that impact, if you will.

headline: The Western Union Company, Q4 2015 Earnings Call, Feb 09, 2016
componenttextpreview: Okay. I didn't know if there is any kind of nuances in there. And then just in terms of the continued spending on the compliance side, the 3.5% to 4%, is it the same type of spend and is that independent of the technology spend or is that all wrapped in o
componenttext: Okay. I didn't know if there is any kind of nuances in there. And then just in terms of the continued spending on the compliance side, the 3.5% to 4%, is it the same type of spend and is that independent of the technology spend or is that all wrapped in one?

headline: The Western Union Company, Q4 2015 Earnings Call, Feb 09, 2016
componenttextpreview: Yes, it's a similar type of spend. Well over half of the spending is for people cost and we have over 2,000 people on the compliance organization here at Western Union. We obviously have them in various centers around the world. So that's where a lot of t
componenttext: Yes, it's a similar type of spend. Well over half of the spending is for people cost and we have over 2,000 people on the compliance organization here at Western Union. We obviously have them in various centers around the world. So that's where a lot of the spending is, but we're continuing to invest in technology and outside services to optimize our spending there as much as we can, so -- but it is largely the same kind of spending, but just this is a global effort, if you will. So we're going to continue to expand these programs around the world.

headline: The Western Union Company, Q4 2015 Earnings Call, Feb 09, 2016
componenttextpreview: Our next question is from Tom McCrohan of CLSA.
componenttext: Our next question is from Tom McCrohan of CLSA.

headline: The Western Union Company, Q4 2015 Earnings Call, Feb 09, 2016
componenttextpreview: What's your expectations this year for total growth in cross-border principal which I think ended the year, constant currency, about 1%?
componenttext: What's your expectations this year for total growth in cross-border principal which I think ended the year, constant currency, about 1%?

headline: The Western Union Company, Q4 2015 Earnings Call, Feb 09, 2016
componenttextpreview: Yes. Well, the World Bank has estimated principal growth to be 1% this year, but as we know, that information is more directional than anything else. And as the data continues to come in and get updated, so we'll see where that ultimately ends up. Last ye
componenttext: Yes. Well, the World Bank has estimated principal growth to be 1% this year, but as we know, that information is more directional than anything else. And as the data continues to come in and get updated, so we'll see where that ultimately ends up. Last year, our principal grew by 2% on a constant currency basis and then was down 5% on a reported basis.

headline: The Western Union Company, Q4 2015 Earnings Call, Feb 09, 2016
componenttextpreview: And can you give us a sense for the proportion of your total cross-border principal that is oil sensitive or emanating from oil-producing countries?
componenttext: And can you give us a sense for the proportion of your total cross-border principal that is oil sensitive or emanating from oil-producing countries?

headline: The Western Union Company, Q4 2015 Earnings Call, Feb 09, 2016
componenttextpreview: Yes. I mean, if you look at the oil-producing countries in which we operate, it's -- the revenue generated from those countries is in that 10% to 15% range, and it's really a mix story in those oil producing nations. As Hikmet mentioned earlier, the UAE a
componenttext: Yes. I mean, if you look at the oil-producing countries in which we operate, it's -- the revenue generated from those countries is in that 10% to 15% range, and it's really a mix story in those oil producing nations. As Hikmet mentioned earlier, the UAE and Saudi Arabia have continued to thus far, show decent growth. But we have other markets like Angola, Libya and others that are having -- and Russia as well, that are just having a challenging time. So it's really a mixed bag and then the broader impacts from lower oil prices in other outbound markets is also a mix story. We have had good growth in some key outbound markets as a result, I think, of just those kinds of situations, so -- but generally, 10% to 15% of revenues is from oil-producing nations.

headline: The Western Union Company, Q4 2015 Earnings Call, Feb 09, 2016
componenttextpreview: And the trends post the end of the quarter at Saudi Arabia and UAE, were they still similar to what you experienced during the quarter?
componenttext: And the trends post the end of the quarter at Saudi Arabia and UAE, were they still similar to what you experienced during the quarter?

headline: The Western Union Company, Q4 2015 Earnings Call, Feb 09, 2016
componenttextpreview: Well, we don't give any inter-quarter information but from the fourth quarter, that's where we saw the state really hit the stage.
componenttext: Well, we don't give any inter-quarter information but from the fourth quarter, that's where we saw the state really hit the stage.

headline: The Western Union Company, Q4 2015 Earnings Call, Feb 09, 2016
componenttextpreview: Our next question is from Bob Napoli of William Blair.
componenttext: Our next question is from Bob Napoli of William Blair.

headline: The Western Union Company, Q4 2015 Earnings Call, Feb 09, 2016
componenttextpreview: With your competitors signing a new contract with Walmart, I think that contract -- the old contract excluded Walmart from talking to Western Union, I believe. And this contract, I think, was less exclusive than the prior one. So I just wondered if you ha
componenttext: With your competitors signing a new contract with Walmart, I think that contract -- the old contract excluded Walmart from talking to Western Union, I believe. And this contract, I think, was less exclusive than the prior one. So I just wondered if you had any -- if there are any thoughts if Western Union was increasingly interested in Walmart, if you think there -- maybe leave it there and get an answer to that question.

headline: The Western Union Company, Q4 2015 Earnings Call, Feb 09, 2016
componenttextpreview: Bob, that's a good question but as you know, we don't make any comments on any negotiations or any other specific partnership capabilities as you could imagine, from competitive reasons. And generally, I don't do that. But I just can tell you that I am in
componenttext: Bob, that's a good question but as you know, we don't make any comments on any negotiations or any other specific partnership capabilities as you could imagine, from competitive reasons. And generally, I don't do that. But I just can tell you that I am interested on any partner to grow out my business. I believe that we will look always to grow our business and -- but it has to be profitable. It has to pay back not for any price and we want to get new customers. We want to get additional customers and we will definitely look in any potential partnership worldwide anywhere.

headline: The Western Union Company, Q4 2015 Earnings Call, Feb 09, 2016
componenttextpreview: You're not excluded from any of your other partners from working with Walmart, and do you think nonexclusive sends are the way of the future in the U.S.?
componenttext: You're not excluded from any of your other partners from working with Walmart, and do you think nonexclusive sends are the way of the future in the U.S.?

headline: The Western Union Company, Q4 2015 Earnings Call, Feb 09, 2016
componenttextpreview: Generally, I would say that I can only speak for my business, the exclusivity generally and the exclusivity has been very stable. And our top 40 agents or 35 agents, they have been exclusive more than 18 years and they -- most of the agents are choosing t
componenttext: Generally, I would say that I can only speak for my business, the exclusivity generally and the exclusivity has been very stable. And our top 40 agents or 35 agents, they have been exclusive more than 18 years and they -- most of the agents are choosing the exclusive because they know they have a quite stable partner, financially stable, good anti-money laundering system, good settlement system, long rent capability, great rent and they can drop money in 200 countries immediately. So the exclusive comes not to count both sides, obviously. And they would like to protect good partnership for a longer time. Then we have also host-to-host connections, we have IT implementation with our partners. And so I feel for my part of business, quite comfortable on the exclusive.

headline: The Western Union Company, Q4 2015 Earnings Call, Feb 09, 2016
componenttextpreview: And you're not excluded from working with Walmart from like from Kroger or any of your other partners?
componenttext: And you're not excluded from working with Walmart from like from Kroger or any of your other partners?

headline: The Western Union Company, Q4 2015 Earnings Call, Feb 09, 2016
componenttextpreview: I don't -- I can answer that question, but I guess not, I don't know. I mean, you have to ask that question to the others, not to me.
componenttext: I don't -- I can answer that question, but I guess not, I don't know. I mean, you have to ask that question to the others, not to me.

headline: The Western Union Company, Q4 2015 Earnings Call, Feb 09, 2016
componenttextpreview: Okay. And Raj, you have -- you mentioned a $1 billion of debt coming due in 2016. With credit spreads having widened so much, is there any -- what would be the impact if you were to refinance that debt today on your interest expense?
componenttext: Okay. And Raj, you have -- you mentioned a $1 billion of debt coming due in 2016. With credit spreads having widened so much, is there any -- what would be the impact if you were to refinance that debt today on your interest expense?

headline: The Western Union Company, Q4 2015 Earnings Call, Feb 09, 2016
componenttextpreview: Taking everything into account, Bob, where we see interest expense being similar to last year, so potentially higher interest rates for that refinancing, but we have lower overall average debt balance of this year as we paid off some maturities from last
componenttext: Taking everything into account, Bob, where we see interest expense being similar to last year, so potentially higher interest rates for that refinancing, but we have lower overall average debt balance of this year as we paid off some maturities from last year. So those 2 things would largely offset. I would expect to see interest expense similar to last year.

headline: The Western Union Company, Q4 2015 Earnings Call, Feb 09, 2016
componenttextpreview: Okay, and last question. With your Investor Day coming up and why now for the Investor Day and are you planning on giving any medium to longer-term financial targets as part of your Investor Day?
componenttext: Okay, and last question. With your Investor Day coming up and why now for the Investor Day and are you planning on giving any medium to longer-term financial targets as part of your Investor Day?

headline: The Western Union Company, Q4 2015 Earnings Call, Feb 09, 2016
componenttextpreview: Well, as you know, our Investor Day is coming beginning of March and we are very proud about our strategies, what we're going to tell to our shareholders are really how we transform the company, how we get to the new use cases, how we get to the new -- ou
componenttext: Well, as you know, our Investor Day is coming beginning of March and we are very proud about our strategies, what we're going to tell to our shareholders are really how we transform the company, how we get to the new use cases, how we get to the new -- our WU Connect platform, how our strength is strong about our retail money transfer business. And we will also like to talk to the uniqueness of the Western Union cross-border engine, cross-border platform. And I think within that environment, we would like to talk to our long-term and all our shareholders, how comfortable we feel about future of the company.

headline: The Western Union Company, Q4 2015 Earnings Call, Feb 09, 2016
componenttextpreview: Our next question is from Danyal Hussain of Morgan Stanley.
componenttext: Our next question is from Danyal Hussain of Morgan Stanley.

headline: The Western Union Company, Q4 2015 Earnings Call, Feb 09, 2016
componenttextpreview: Just another one on the $50 million tax spend. I know it's early to talk about 2017, but just wanted to get a sense for whether this $50 million is elevated in anyway or whether this is maybe a go forward investment rate for now?
componenttext: Just another one on the $50 million tax spend. I know it's early to talk about 2017, but just wanted to get a sense for whether this $50 million is elevated in anyway or whether this is maybe a go forward investment rate for now?

headline: The Western Union Company, Q4 2015 Earnings Call, Feb 09, 2016
componenttextpreview: Well, the $50 million certainly has some one-time costs in there. But again, we're trying to upgrade our platform, so there's also some ongoing cost in that spend. As we add more partners to the mix, especially on the digital side, partners like Viber and
componenttext: Well, the $50 million certainly has some one-time costs in there. But again, we're trying to upgrade our platform, so there's also some ongoing cost in that spend. As we add more partners to the mix, especially on the digital side, partners like Viber and WeChat, as we have more of those, we will continue to invest in the technology area. So too early to say whether it's only one-time in nature or how much of it is one-time in nature. I expect some elevated tax spending to continue but again, that allows us to be faster to market, allows us to be more flexible on how we provide services, and it also allows us to add new kinds of partners to our business which is really why we're doing it.

headline: The Western Union Company, Q4 2015 Earnings Call, Feb 09, 2016
componenttextpreview: Got it. And then not to beat a dead horse in oil, but I'll try to ask the question a different way. So Saudi Arabia, I think they are the second largest send market and they did cut their budget in December. So at this point, are you taking a wait-and-see
componenttext: Got it. And then not to beat a dead horse in oil, but I'll try to ask the question a different way. So Saudi Arabia, I think they are the second largest send market and they did cut their budget in December. So at this point, are you taking a wait-and-see approach for your expectation for 2016, even if you haven't seen any impact yet or are you baking, I guess, some sort of headwind now?

headline: The Western Union Company, Q4 2015 Earnings Call, Feb 09, 2016
componenttextpreview: Yes, I think generally, I am cautious, right, about global economic. It's not Saudi Arabia specific but generally, there is -- the environment didn't get better, it's really very volatile. But once again, I just want to make the point, none of our countri
componenttext: Yes, I think generally, I am cautious, right, about global economic. It's not Saudi Arabia specific but generally, there is -- the environment didn't get better, it's really very volatile. But once again, I just want to make the point, none of our countries from revenue side is bigger -- outside the U.S., bigger than 7%. So we have a really quite balanced environment. I mean, as Raj mentioned earlier, Germany, for instance, produced pretty good outbound numbers again which is obviously engine of Europe and continue to produce that. So I feel comfortable that being that global, having that portfolio, we could respond better than the other companies to the economic challenges.

headline: The Western Union Company, Q4 2015 Earnings Call, Feb 09, 2016
componenttextpreview: Okay. And then if I could just follow-up on Darrin's earlier question on tax. I know this issue does come up a lot for us, so just wondering if it's possible to provide maybe an example of one of these working capital strategies that you used to repatriat
componenttext: Okay. And then if I could just follow-up on Darrin's earlier question on tax. I know this issue does come up a lot for us, so just wondering if it's possible to provide maybe an example of one of these working capital strategies that you used to repatriate cash without paying for the U.S. commercial tax?

headline: The Western Union Company, Q4 2015 Earnings Call, Feb 09, 2016
componenttextpreview: Yes, all I would say is that we move a lot of money around the world annually. We move hundreds of billions of dollars around the world globally on an annual basis, and we have a lot of payment flows between our various companies around the world. So we t
componenttext: Yes, all I would say is that we move a lot of money around the world annually. We move hundreds of billions of dollars around the world globally on an annual basis, and we have a lot of payment flows between our various companies around the world. So we try to optimize those as best as we can. And I am happy to talk more about that offline if you'd like to, but it's really just optimizing the cash flows that we have within the company.

componenttext: I had 2 questions. One, Raj, I missed the full comment but could you just go back over the $25 million of headwind from Argentina? I didn't catch that. I just want to make sure I understand it then I had a follow-up.

headline: The Western Union Company, Q4 2015 Earnings Call, Feb 09, 2016
componenttextpreview: Sure. I think you're referring to -- well, we have a -- this year, we have an overall impact from currency and profit of about $100 million. $25 million of that is from the Argentina peso devaluation that took place in December of last year. Another $25 m
componenttext: Sure. I think you're referring to -- well, we have a -- this year, we have an overall impact from currency and profit of about $100 million. $25 million of that is from the Argentina peso devaluation that took place in December of last year. Another $25 million-plus is from year-over-year changes in hedge gains. So we have hedge gains this year that are less than last year. So last year, we had $78 million in hedge gains. This year, we have around $50 million based on our current rate assumptions, and that's a negative to the margins. And then the remaining piece of it is just overall translations. So the -- we have a revenue impact of $250 million in our top line this year and a $100 million impact to profits, and that combination is a negative to our operating margins this year of around 100 basis points.

headline: The Western Union Company, Q4 2015 Earnings Call, Feb 09, 2016

headline: The Western Union Company, Q4 2015 Earnings Call, Feb 09, 2016
componenttextpreview: Got you. And my follow-up, going sort of westernunion.com and sort of the global expansion that you seem to be moving on here more aggressively. Is there anything around reallocating marketing budgets or elevated levels of marketing or anything like that,
componenttext: Got you. And my follow-up, going sort of westernunion.com and sort of the global expansion that you seem to be moving on here more aggressively. Is there anything around reallocating marketing budgets or elevated levels of marketing or anything like that, as you really open up this platform that we should think about in terms of operating leverage, whether pros or corns as you roll this out more globally and really try to accelerate it?

headline: The Western Union Company, Q4 2015 Earnings Call, Feb 09, 2016
componenttextpreview: Yes. I think, absolutely. I think we are focused on the send [ph] countries, major send countries, obviously. The 34 countries which I [ph] mentioned earlier are the major send [ph] countries. Now we are -- we have almost all European countries. Obviously
componenttext: Yes. I think, absolutely. I think we are focused on the send [ph] countries, major send countries, obviously. The 34 countries which I [ph] mentioned earlier are the major send [ph] countries. Now we are -- we have almost all European countries. Obviously, now we're starting to have our -- we are by the way, in Europe, we are using our bank license there and to expand the westernunion.com. And now, the next step is in Europe, putting promotions and marketing programs there to drive the revenue even stronger which is a good strong -- but the base is still small but growing stronger. And now we recently opened an office in Asia to expand our activities also, westernunion.com activities to send [ph] Asian countries like in Singapore, Hong Kong, but also in Middle East like typical countries in Middle East, outbound countries. And you'll hear coming up, new announcements on that, using our capabilities. And I believe it's really attracting new customer segments. For instance, people who want to send in a different way, don't want to carry cash in a location. And we saw the similar pattern also in Europe. These are additional customers, not one that use retail, but still they want to use Western Union and add additional growth. And that's going to happen, I believe, also in Asia.

headline: The Western Union Company, Q4 2015 Earnings Call, Feb 09, 2016
componenttextpreview: So are you comfortable in terms of the P&L impact that there's not any pressure on margins? This will just be reallocating your existing marketing budget to different channels and countries, not anything necessarily incremental on a material level?
componenttext: So are you comfortable in terms of the P&L impact that there's not any pressure on margins? This will just be reallocating your existing marketing budget to different channels and countries, not anything necessarily incremental on a material level?

componenttext:
Yes, Tim. From a marketing standpoint, we've been spending just under 4% of revenues as a company in the last few years, but we have been reallocating more to the digital areas and that will probably continue, but not affecting the overall budget.
And I think we have time for one more question and I there's 1 more person in the queue.

componenttext: Our last question today is from Oscar Turner of SunTrust.

headline: The Western Union Company, Q4 2015 Earnings Call, Feb 09, 2016
componenttextpreview: So you mentioned that overall, you expect C2C pricing trends to remain stable in 2016. I was just wondering if you can provide some general color on the proportion of markets where you're typically able to raise prices versus perhaps those that are more c
componenttext: So you mentioned that overall, you expect C2C pricing trends to remain stable in 2016. I was just wondering if you can provide some general color on the proportion of markets where you're typically able to raise prices versus perhaps those that are more competitive?

headline: The Western Union Company, Q4 2015 Earnings Call, Feb 09, 2016
componenttextpreview: We have 16,000 corridors that we operate in. So we have a number of different combinations that you could envision, but it's very hard for us to tell you specifically by country. We typically -- in many countries, we're priced above the overall average. I
componenttext: We have 16,000 corridors that we operate in. So we have a number of different combinations that you could envision, but it's very hard for us to tell you specifically by country. We typically -- in many countries, we're priced above the overall average. In other countries, we're priced below. And we also have different channels that we're also utilizing. So in our wu.com business, we actually are priced quite competitively with similar kinds of products. So it really just depends on which quarters you're talking about, which channels and there's a multitude of different combinations that we could be looking at. But in markets where we believe the value proposition is not aligned then we'll take the opportunity to look at that. It could be pricing changes in foreign exchange, it could been in fees. So it's hard for me to tell you a specific area where we do that.

headline: The Western Union Company, Q4 2015 Earnings Call, Feb 09, 2016
componenttextpreview: Yes, sometimes we increase prices in different bands, current corridors and lower bands, increase or decrease pricing and increase on the higher bands. So it's really a very intelligent price product we have. And this is based on the market environment, w
componenttext: Yes, sometimes we increase prices in different bands, current corridors and lower bands, increase or decrease pricing and increase on the higher bands. So it's really a very intelligent price product we have. And this is based on the market environment, we adapt the prices to the customer needs and that's what we do.

headline: The Western Union Company, Q4 2015 Earnings Call, Feb 09, 2016
componenttextpreview: Okay. And then second question, you've talked a lot about expanding wu.com geographically and then also growing WU Connect. I was just wondering how you guys think about possible cannibalization there or at this point, are they so small that it's not even
componenttext: Okay. And then second question, you've talked a lot about expanding wu.com geographically and then also growing WU Connect. I was just wondering how you guys think about possible cannibalization there or at this point, are they so small that it's not even a concern?

headline: The Western Union Company, Q4 2015 Earnings Call, Feb 09, 2016
componenttextpreview: Well, we think that -- well, first of all, our wu.com business is growing very, very well. And in 34 markets, we're paying out everywhere -- almost everywhere in the world in cash and then we're delivering money into accounts into more than 50 markets. So
componenttext: Well, we think that -- well, first of all, our wu.com business is growing very, very well. And in 34 markets, we're paying out everywhere -- almost everywhere in the world in cash and then we're delivering money into accounts into more than 50 markets. So that business continues to have a lot of good growth potential, but we also believe that most of -- many of -- much of the WU Connect opportunity is incremental in nature. It's too early to really tell you exactly how that's going to play out, but we believe that that's going to be a good incremental revenue and profit opportunity for Western Union because it's a new kind of customer. They may use us in a different way, different use cases than we have in our core business. So there's -- we just need more time.

componenttext: Yes, to westernunion.com, to my point. In westernunion.com, we're getting more than 80% of our customers are still new to Western Union overall. So it's -- we think it's largely an incremental opportunity but we'll see. We'll have more experience over the next several months and years.

componenttext: Good afternoon, and welcome to the Western Union First Quarter 2016 Earnings Conference Call. [Operator Instructions] Please note, this event is being recorded. I would now like to turn the conference over to Mike Salop, Senior Vice President of Investor Relations. Please go ahead, sir.

headline: The Western Union Company, Q1 2016 Earnings Call, May 03, 2016
componenttextpreview: Thank you, Laura. On today's call, Hikmet Ersek, Western Union's President and Chief Executive Officer; and Raj Agrawal, Executive Vice President and Chief Financial Officer will discuss the company's 2016 first quarter results and then we will take your
componenttext:
Thank you, Laura. On today's call, Hikmet Ersek, Western Union's President and Chief Executive Officer; and Raj Agrawal, Executive Vice President and Chief Financial Officer will discuss the company's 2016 first quarter results and then we will take your questions. The slides that accompany this call and webcast can be found at westernunion.com under the Investor Relations tab and will remain available after the call. Additional operational statistics have been provided in supplemental tables with our press release. Today's call is being recorded and our comments include forward-looking statements. Please refer to the cautionary language in the earnings release and in Western Union's filings with the Securities and Exchange Commission, including the 2015 Form 10-K, for additional information concerning factors that could cause actual results to differ materially from the forward-looking statements. 
During the call, we will discuss some items that do not conform to Generally Accepted Accounting Principles. We have reconciled those items to the most comparable GAAP measures on our website, westernunion.com, under the Investor Relations section. All statements made by Western Union officers on this call are the property of the Western Union Company and subject to copyright protection. Other than the replay noted in our press release, Western Union has not authorized and disclaims response waiting for any recording, replay or distinction of any transcription of this call. I would now like to turn the call over to Hikmet Ersek.

headline: The Western Union Company, Q1 2016 Earnings Call, May 03, 2016
componenttextpreview: Thank you, Mike, and good afternoon, everyone. Overall, we delivered another solid quarter to start the year as our business continue to show resilience in the face of uneven global economic conditions. First quarter transferred generally similar to the f
componenttext:
Thank you, Mike, and good afternoon, everyone. Overall, we delivered another solid quarter to start the year as our business continue to show resilience in the face of uneven global economic conditions. First quarter transferred generally similar to the fourth quarter. Our consumer money transfer business posted steady results consumer bill payments business provided good constant currency revenue growth and Business Solutions increased as well. 
Although, the stronger dollar continued to impact reported results, total revenue increased 3% for the quarter in constant currency terms. In consumer money transfer, westernunion.com and Germany continue to provide good growth, although we did see some software business in the oil-dependent markets. 
Business Solutions constant currency revenue increased 6% in the quarter and consumer bill payments increased 12%. Operating margins were a healthy 19.9% despite increases in technology investment and negative impacts from currency. We also continue to generate strong cash flow and returned over $300 million to shareholders in the quarter through dividend and share repurchases. the year is starting as expected. As we think about the next several years, as we highlighted at our Investor Day in March, our focus is on maintaining leadership in the traditional retail money transfer business, expanding leadership in digital money transfer and averaging our cross border platform to sell new used cases and customer segments. 
Our traditional retail business continues to deliver steady results and we are making progress on our global digital initiatives. A few digital examples of this year include: the launch of our mobile app for westernunion.com in Italy, which will allow Android and Apple users to access our money transfer services; and refresh mobile app in the U.K.; and new mobile receiving service in Bangladesh reached launched with MasterCard, cash and direct bank; 2 new Western Union sites in Europe, raising our total 36 countries globally with online money transfer sending services. 
In Western Union Business Solutions, we introduced a new service brings buyers and sellers together on one digital B2B platform, where they can easily arrange and complete cross-border invoicing and payments. The platform also provide foreign exchange and cash management tools for users. In addition, as we previously announced, we added the Viber, social messaging app to our WU Connect platform this year. Viber has been in better mode until last week, but we now added account pay out capabilities and are excited to begin our full launch to build awareness and drive usage. We also remain focused on expanding our paying options and account payout network and initiating more corridor connections to bank accounts. 
I have spent a lot of time over the last several weeks traveling throughout Europe and Asia including attending the European Money 2020 conference in reinforce believe the importance of the end-to-end capabilities that we have seen providing in cross-border money movement and in our ability to leverage our assets for more funding and funds out used cases. I saw an example of this China, where we work with China Pay to offer cross-border payment for business customers in the country. We also provide many other digital service in China with Western Union Money transfer available on several online and mobile banking platforms. 
Our collaborations in China and all other examples I have mentioned, further comments that our services can provide very valuable connection to partners whether they are financial institutions, social media or messaging companies, mobile operators or more traditional retailers. So we see many opportunities, and I believe, we have the right strategy to address them. Thus far in 2016, our business performance has been solid and we are on track with our full year expectations, while we continue to make progress on our long-term strategies. Now to discuss the first quarter results in more detail, I would like to turn the call over to Raj

headline: The Western Union Company, Q1 2016 Earnings Call, May 03, 2016
componenttextpreview: Thank you, Hikmet. Overall, we are pleased with the first quarter results. This quarter revenues of $1.3 billion, increased 3% on a constant-currency basis compared to the prior year period, while reported revenues declined 2% due to the impact of the str
componenttext:
Thank you, Hikmet. Overall, we are pleased with the first quarter results. This quarter revenues of $1.3 billion, increased 3% on a constant-currency basis compared to the prior year period, while reported revenues declined 2% due to the impact of the stronger U.S. dollar. The impact of currency translation net of hedge benefits reduced first quarter revenue by approximately $57 million compared to the prior year period. In the Consumer-to-Consumer segment, constant currency revenues increased 1% in the quarter and reported revenues declined 2%, while transactions grew 3%. C2C constant currency revenue growth was driven by westernunion.com and continued to strengthen U.S. outbound, particularly to Mexico and Latin America. The total C2C cross-border principal declined 2% compared to the prior year period or increased 1% constant currency.
Principal per transaction was down 5% or down 3% in constant currency terms, with a decline driven by several oil-related markets. The spread between the C2C transaction growth and the revenue decline in the quarter was approximately 5 percentage points, including a negative 3% impact from currency. We continue to view the global pricing environment as very stable. The impact of net price increases of 2% in the quarter, but this was primarily related to Argentina, where significant reductions on our outbound pricing in response to the economic and currency deterioration in the country and from the actions we took in our U.S. domestic money transfer business since April of last year. 
Outside of these 2 actions, pricing impact would have been neutral in the quarter and mix was also neutral. Turning to the regions. As we did last year, due to the significant fluctuations in foreign exchange rates, I will be referring to constant currency movements as I discuss individual country contributions to the regional results. Also as previously mentioned, we have made a change to our C2C regional reporting effective in the first quarter. We are now including the westernunion.com business within the regional numbers, splitting the revenue between 50-50 sand and regions, which is consistent with how we treat to the retail business. 
The convertible quarterly numbers for 2015 can be found in our earnings release and we will also continue to report westernunion.com revenue and transaction growth rate at supplemental information. In the quarter, North America revenue grew 3% or 5% on an constant-currency basis while transactions increased 7%. The region benefited from strong growth in U.S. outbound to Mexico and Latin America with our Mexico business again outpacing the market based on the latest Banco de Mexico data for the first quarter. 
Total domestic money transfer revenue was flat in the quarter, transaction growth of 5%. In the European CIS region, revenue declined 3% and was flat on a constant-currency basis, while transaction increased 3%. Similar to previous quarters, Germany delivered strong growth, but the positive impact was offset by continued weakness in Russia. In the Middle East and Africa region, revenue declined 4% or 1% constant currency and transactions were down 3%. Low oil prices are affecting the region's results as many Gulf states have experienced slowdown in the investment in hiring. The main declines were from Nigeria, where the inbound business has been affected by a wide divergence between market exchange rates and the official rates, resulting from oil impact on the economy. 
Saudi Arabia revenues increased, but trends were not as strong as previous quarters. In Asia Pacific region, revenue was down 4% or down 1% constant currency, while transactions decreased 4%, primarily due to continued weakness in the Philippines. In addition, some markets in Asia have negatively impacted by from lower from the oil-producing countries. Revenue in the Latin America and Caribbean region was down 5%, but increased 1% constant currency. Transactions increased 11% in the quarter. Revenue was driven -- revenue growth was driven by strong inbound business from the U.S., but this was largely offset by the pricing directions in Argentina. Westernunion.com C2C revenue, which included in the regional numbers as discussed, grew 16% in the quarter or 18% constant currency and represented 7% of total C2C revenue. 
Westernunion.com transactions increased 25% with the U.S. originated online transactions going 28%. Mobile continues to be a fast-growing area for wu.com with our 55% U.S. transactions being initiated on a mobile device in the quarter. The online business was also gaining traction on cents 2 accounts through our expanding account payout network. The spread between transaction revenue growth for wu.com in the quarter was primarily due to lower principal per transaction and other mix. This was driven by the high growth in mobile transactions, which tend to have a smaller principal amount. 
As Hikmet mentioned, we have online transactions in 36 countries, which allow us to present over 200 countries in territory. And we expect strong growth from wu.com as the year progresses as we expand our present and further enhance our service offering. 
In the Consumer-to-Business segment, revenue declined 1%, but increased 12% on a constant-currency basis. Driven by growth in Argentina and U.S. electronic businesses, which was partially offset by declines in U.S. cash walk-in. Depreciation of the Argentina peso drove the differential between reported and constant currency revenue. Business Solutions reported revenues increased 1% or 6% on a constant-currency basis, by strong sales of hedging products in Europe. The consolidated operating profit margin was 19.9% in the quarter compared to 20.6% in the prior year period. As expected, the operating margin was negatively impacted by incremental technology expense and the impact of foreign exchange, which was partially offset by benefits from cost-savings and operational efficiencies and the timing of certain expenses. 
Hedge gains in the quarter was similar to the prior year with $15 million of gains in the current quarter compared to $16 million of gains in the first quarter of 2015. In total, currency negatively impacted operating profit by approximately $17 million in the quarter compared to prior year. Compliance expense was approximately 3.6% of revenue compared to 3.8% in the prior year period. EBITDA margin of 25% in the quarter compared to 25.5% in the prior year period and as expected our tax rate of 14.6% increased from 12.3% in the first quarter of last year. 
In combination with share repurchase, these results generated earnings per share of $0.37, down slightly from $0.39 a year ago. The C2C segment operating margin was 22.7% compared to 23.1% in the prior-year period. The C2C operating margin was negatively impacted by higher technology expense and the impact of foreign exchange, which were partially offset by benefits from cost-savings and operational efficiencies and the timing of certain expenses. 
The Consumer-to-Business operating margin was 14.6% in the quarter compared to 18.7% in the prior year period, with the decrease primary due to increased technology expense. Business Solutions operating profit of $2 million was consistent with the prior year period, while EBITDA margins improved from 14.6% to 15.1%. 
Depreciation and amortization for Business Solutions was approximately $13 million in the quarter compared to $12 million in the prior year. 
Turning to our cash flow and balance sheet. Cash flow from operating activities was $213 million for the quarter, while capital expenses were $48 million. At the end of the quarter, the company had debt of $3.2 billion and cash of $1.2 billion. Approximately 35% of the cash was held by United States entities. In the first quarter, we paid $79 million in dividends and repurchased approximately 13 million shares or a total of $240 million. Our remaining authorization, which expires in December of 2017, was $472 million at quarter end and the outstanding share count at the end of March was 492,000,000 shares. Based on the first quarter results and our recent business trends, we are reaffirming our full year outlook -- financial outlook for constant currency revenue growth, operating profit margin, earnings per share and operating cash flow. We've maintained our constant currency revenue outlook a low to mid-single-digit increase. Operating margin at approximately 20% and earnings per share in the range of $1.58 to $1.70. The GAAP revenue now expected to be approximately $50 million higher than our initial outlook based on the recent strengthening of several currencies against the U.S. dollar. Compared to 2015 rates, we now expect currency to have a negative impact on revenues of approximately $200 million for the full year. This equates to a GAAP revenue changes 300 basis points lower than the constant currency increase, rather than the 400 basis points in the prior outlook. The impact on operating profit from the increased revenues is expected to be partially offset by a reduction in hedge benefits with hedge gains now projected at approximately $40 million compared to $50 million in the prior outlook. 
The new projection for totally new impact in operating profit from currency net of hedges is now at approximately $90 million, a slight improvement from the approximately $100 million negative impact anticipated in our prior outlook. Since EPS -- since the impact on EPS was relatively small and we are still early in the year, we did not change our EPS outlook. As exchange rates stabilized or move during the year, we will up update our outlook accordingly. So to summarize, our first quarter results were solid and we are on track for the year. Cash flow and balance sheet remain strong and we continue to return significant funds to stakeholders. Operator, we are now ready to take questions.

And Raj, just incremental technology expense that weighed on the margins, is there a way to think about that, how much that was in total, versus the year-ago period and kind of thinking about that going forward versus some of the offsets from some of the restructuring cost-savings, just to think about operating margin and some of the puts and takes there?

headline: The Western Union Company, Q1 2016 Earnings Call, May 03, 2016
componenttextpreview: Yes. The operating margin was impacted by a few things. Technology was one of them and then we had some negative foreign exchange impact and then we have some benefits from cost-savings and timing and expenses as well. The technology expense we said when
componenttext: Yes. The operating margin was impacted by a few things. Technology was one of them and then we had some negative foreign exchange impact and then we have some benefits from cost-savings and timing and expenses as well. The technology expense we said when we came into the year that we expect to spend well over $50 million incrementally on technology and that's on a base of few hundred million dollars. So if you just take that in each quarter, that's roughly -- the some of the letter quarters will start to go over, if you will. But in total for the year, we see over $50 million of incremental spend on technology. And then, some of the cost-savings, if you recall we took about $11 million of cost in the fourth quarter and there's going to translate to a few million dollars of the savings this year. And then we also are just managing the business very tightly and efficiently on the expense side and we've also had some time and expenses while they helped us in the first quarter. So the primary negative impact was around technology, which again for the year will be well over $50 million incrementally and then some of the negative foreign exchange impact.

headline: The Western Union Company, Q1 2016 Earnings Call, May 03, 2016
componenttextpreview: Bryan, I think our focus didn't change as we gave it in the beginning of the year. I see -- the answer is digital, digital, digital, westernunion.com expansion, is going very strong. Actually, we had 25% transaction growth. And within that -- within the d
componenttext: Bryan, I think our focus didn't change as we gave it in the beginning of the year. I see -- the answer is digital, digital, digital, westernunion.com expansion, is going very strong. Actually, we had 25% transaction growth. And within that -- within the digital is mobile, 55% of our transaction the U.S. are initiated by mobile phones. And it's a little bit lower principal amount respect a little bit revenue per transaction was lower. But generally, that's the direction. I am also excited about the new social media partnership like Viber. Let's see where it goes. It's too early to tell that. But, I believe, that this does will be growth on C2C. And digital to connection to 200 countries. Digital connection to retail, distal connection to our account payout network, which we are more than 1 billion accounts that will come to growth, that will accelerate over the few quarters, I believe. On retail money transfer, I think that, that will continue to be flattish. It will continue to be slow. And -- but I think the team is doing a great job there also keeping the retail money transfer very strong. In fact, recently today, I just saw the Mexico numbers came out and we are winning. I saw again market share there. So that's the thing -- but the global economy for all countries like Russia, like Saudi Arabia has a little bit impact to our growth, and that's I would be cautious there. Other side, the Germany did very well. Within -- even within the Gulf states, UAE did very well. I mean, that's differentiate country-by-country.

I'm not sure if that's going to continue. It can turn around back again. I don't see a major issue, but we call it out because we first slowdowns and Russia, we always called out.

So these are the areas will be an offset to some of these other softer areas.

componenttext: I just wanted to ask a follow-up question on because I can appreciate the mix dynamics here. Thinking about sort of rest of the year and on constant currency revenue growth potential of the business, because I know that the year-over-year comparisons on that metric are going to get tougher the rest of the year and probably wouldn't be surprising if the mobile mix continues to accelerate 55% levels you saw on the U.S. this quarter, just given the way consumer preferences are trending. So -- just so we've got the expectation up properly, I mean, this 18-ish percent number we saw in Q1, is that a decent run rate? Or natural swap in the rest of the year because of the tougher comps and because of some potential acceleration of the mix shift to mobile within the channel?

headline: The Western Union Company, Q1 2016 Earnings Call, May 03, 2016

componenttext: Well, Jason, it's more and more is better. Obviously, we want to grow faster. I think our plans are we want to grow our revenue the revenue growth, and we are working on that. Especially also expansion under new global -- new geographies will help that also, because of these are just started new geographies was the customer gets sticky, they started to get revenue also there, right? And, I believe, that our plans are built on a stronger growth definitely also. And the mix is definitely something that the customer behavior is changing. But I believe, also that we just launched in Italy new mobile app. We have also in U.K., we upgraded of our mobile up there. People are using more mobile and they are more sticky and we are responding to the customer needs, and I think that will grow stronger.

componenttext: I can tell you -- them and I can try to quantify for you. It's not -- it's a little bit of a difference I don't think we have the real data behind that, but it's enough to make a difference because of the significant growth that you're getting on mobile. It's probably $20, $30 difference, that doesn't make a difference on the transaction, but when you have such strong growth on this transaction, that's making the difference on the overall picture. And I would just say that as we add new features, as we add new geographies, more channels, more bank funding and more bank payout, all of these things are going to layer in more growth opportunity for us as we move forward.

componenttext: Let me give a short and the right answer to that question, Raj feel free to jump in. But -- on the most of the transaction on the first part of your question, most of the transactions are generated in the countries, where we've been longer obviously, like the U.S., U.K., like the countries we've been like Germany. We've been longer with our online services. And the new countries, it takes a while when they come to the portfolio and it's a promotion part. It's most of the part -- the majority of the transactions are definitely from the countries, where we had been. And it's good also because it's more -- we see also on the digital is that the customer use more often. Our services when they use online, when they want to register, they stay there and they use it. So that's great news. The second part of the question is on the 50-50, it's basically the combining our efforts, marketing efforts and our branding efforts, our go-to-market efforts together with the regions. As you know, we were very much focused with the digital have a good start up $300 million revenue approximately a year. I believe, we are the market leader in the digital space and we are growing strong here and now, it's time to really expanding that faster globally using our Asian agent network. Within the Asian network, also we are promoting our westernunion.com and combining our agent activities, regulator activities in the regions with business. That's the positive side. That's why we are putting that also on the region.

Some of the spending started to ramp late last year. So we may start to grow over some of that towards the end of the year. But that's really what I was trying to say.

headline: The Western Union Company, Q1 2016 Earnings Call, May 03, 2016
componenttextpreview: Okay. And the incremental spending -- I mean, in the first Raj, you mentioned, investing in the core platform, investing in Big Data, what is this incremental investing or is it more -- I mean, I saw that you guys did a block chain investment, but that se
componenttext: Okay. And the incremental spending -- I mean, in the first Raj, you mentioned, investing in the core platform, investing in Big Data, what is this incremental investing or is it more -- I mean, I saw that you guys did a block chain investment, but that seems more like a financing type of thing, but...

headline: The Western Union Company, Q1 2016 Earnings Call, May 03, 2016
componenttextpreview: Yes, the block chain investment is nominal investment -- we make investments like that from time to time to stay close to things that are happening in that space. But the technology spend, the incremental spend is really upgrading our legacy platforms, ou
componenttext: Yes, the block chain investment is nominal investment -- we make investments like that from time to time to stay close to things that are happening in that space. But the technology spend, the incremental spend is really upgrading our legacy platforms, our settlement system, our data centers and our core processing capability. And so it upgrades systems. It allows us to be more nimble on the market, and it also allows us to be better fit it to serve digital partners as we add them. And some of these are multiyear programs, right? So they are not going to be done in a 1-year period. They're going to continue on for a couple of years. And so that's really where the spending is geared towards.

headline: The Western Union Company, Q1 2016 Earnings Call, May 03, 2016

componenttext: Got it. When say multiyear, can you to put at time frame? I mean, is it the middle of next year or...
